fields.value: The effect of memory in inducing pleasant emotions of musical and pictorial stimuli

authorAffiliation.value: Max Planck Institute for Empirical Aesthetics, Germany

dsDescriptionValue.value: This contains all data (behavioural, neural, and stimuli) collected in the study titled "THE EFFECT OF MEMORY IN INDUCING PLEASANT EMOTIONS OF MUSICAL AND PICTORIAL STIMULI" by Johanna Maksimainen, Jan Wikgren, Tuomas Eerola,  and Suvi Saarikallio published in Scientific Reports 5 December 2018: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-018-35899-y

keywordValue.value: music, images, emotion, mechanisms, eeg, self-reports

publicationCitation.value: Maksimainen, J., Wikgren, J., Eerola, T., & Saarikallio, S. (2018). The Effect of Memory in Inducing Pleasant Emotions with Musical and Pictorial Stimuli. Scientific Reports, 8(1), 17638. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-018-35899-y

fields.value: Citation to the published study added 5 December 2018.

files.description: Behavioural data related to the individual differences of participants, and their current mood and ratings of emotions.  See release_notes.pdf for information about the organisation of the file.
files.label: behavioural_data.tab

dataFile.description: Behavioural data related to the individual differences of participants, and their current mood and ratings of emotions.  See release_notes.pdf for information about the organisation of the file.

files.description: The second set of behavioral data concerns the ratings done for the items the participants brought to the experiment (4 musical, 4 visual). See release_notes.pdf for information about the organisation of the file.
files.label: item_responses_data.tab

dataFile.description: The second set of behavioral data concerns the ratings done for the items the participants brought to the experiment (4 musical, 4 visual). See release_notes.pdf for information about the organisation of the file.

files.description: The experiment consisted of four excerpts by 30 participants representing 2 stimulus mechanism categories (Memory/Stimulus) crossed with Valence (Pleasant / Unpleant), yielding 30 x 4 = 120 music examples. An ascii file named `music_features.csv` contains the filenames, the indices for the factors and acoustic variables. See release_notes.pdf for information about the organisation of the file.
files.label: music_features.tab

dataFile.description: The experiment consisted of four excerpts by 30 participants representing 2 stimulus mechanism categories (Memory/Stimulus) crossed with Valence (Pleasant / Unpleant), yielding 30 x 4 = 120 music examples. An ascii file named `music_features.csv` contains the filenames, the indices for the factors and acoustic variables. See release_notes.pdf for information about the organisation of the file.

files.description: The experiment consisted of four images by all 30 participants that were either pleasant or unpleasant and related to memories or stimulus properties, therefore yielding 120 images. For copyright reasons and due to personal nature of some of the images, we are not able to share the original files here, but we provide thumbnails of the images and the stimulus details. See release_notes.pdf for information about the organisation of the file.
files.label: release_notes.pdf

dataFile.description: The experiment consisted of four images by all 30 participants that were either pleasant or unpleasant and related to memories or stimulus properties, therefore yielding 120 images. For copyright reasons and due to personal nature of some of the images, we are not able to share the original files here, but we provide thumbnails of the images and the stimulus details. See release_notes.pdf for information about the organisation of the file.

files.description: The experiment consisted of four images by all 30 participants that were either pleasant or unpleasant and related to memories or stimulus properties, therefore yielding 120 images. For copyright reasons and due to personal nature of some of the images, we are not able to share the original files here, but we provide thumbnails of the images and the stimulus details (see manuscript for the extraction details). For the analysis of image qualitis, the perceptual hue, saturation, and brightness (HSV) were extracted from the RBG values.
files.label: visual_stimuli.tab

dataFile.description: The experiment consisted of four images by all 30 participants that were either pleasant or unpleasant and related to memories or stimulus properties, therefore yielding 120 images. For copyright reasons and due to personal nature of some of the images, we are not able to share the original files here, but we provide thumbnails of the images and the stimulus details (see manuscript for the extraction details). For the analysis of image qualitis, the perceptual hue, saturation, and brightness (HSV) were extracted from the RBG values.
